contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox album | <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> Name = Pleasure Death | Type = studio | Artist = [[Therapy?]] | Cover = TherapyPleasureDeath.jpg|Album cover | Released = 27 January 1992 | Recorded = late 1991 at [[Southern Studios]], [[London]], England | Genre = [[Alternative rock]], [[noise rock]], [[alternative metal]] | Length = 22:25 | Label = [[Wiiija Records]] | Producer = Harvey Birrell, Therapy? | Last album = ''[[Babyteeth]]''<br />(1991) | This album = '''''Pleasure Death'''''<br />(1992) | Next album = ''[[Caucasian Psychosis]]''<br />(1992) | }} {{Album ratings |rev1 = [[Allmusic]] |rev1score = {{Rating|2|5}}<ref>[{{Allmusic|class=album|id=r522622|pure_url=yes}} Allmusic review]</ref> }}<!-- Automatically generated by DASHBot--> __NOTOC__ '''''Pleasure Death''''' was the second (mini-)album by the band [[Therapy?]].<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.therapyquestionmark.co.uk/discography/albums/pleasuredeath.php | title=Official Discography}}</ref> It was released on 27 January 1992 on [[Wiiija Records]]. The album was recorded in 1991 at [[Southern Studios]], [[London]]. It reached number 1 in the UK Indie Charts.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.therapyquestionmark.co.uk/biography/band/#a_1992 | title=Band Biography (1992) by Andy Cairns}}</ref> The album was originally released by Wiiija on 12” vinyl. In 1993, [[Southern Records]] re-issued the album on 12” vinyl, CD and Cassette. The album was remastered in 2010 by Harvey Birrell and has been touted for possible release since then, although nothing has been confirmed as yet.<ref>{{ cite web | url=http://www.drop-d.ie/interview-therapy/11256 | title= drop-d Interview}}</ref> ==Track listing== All songs written by Therapy? {{Tracklist | total_length = 22:25 | title1 = Skinning Pit | length1 = 6:01 | title2 = Fantasy Bag | length2 = 3:40 | title3 = Shitkicker | length3 = 2:33 | title4 = Prison Breaker | length4 = 4:26 | title5 = D.L.C. | length5 = 2:32 | title6 = Potato Junkie | length6 = 3:09 }} ==Personnel== * [[Andy Cairns]] - vocals, guitar * [[Fyfe Ewing]] - vocals, drums * [[Michael McKeegan]] - bass * Harvey Birrell and Therapy? - producer * Harvey Birrell and [[John Loder (sound engineer)|John Loder]] - engineers * [[George Henry Smyth]] - cover art ==Trivia== * The sample in "Skinning Pit" (“Every once in a while I'd have to take a beating. But by then, I didn’t care. The way I saw it, everybody takes a beating sometime”) is taken from the 1990 movie ''[[Goodfellas]]'' and is spoken by actor [[Ray Liotta]]. * The sample in "Potato Junkie" (“Don’t you ever feel attracted to the girls you photograph…”) is often cited as having come from the 1978 movie ''[[Pretty Baby (film)|Pretty Baby]]'', being spoken by actress [[Brooke Shields]] and actor [[Keith Carradine]]. The British accents in the sample, however, make this impossible. ==References== {{reflist}} {{Therapy?}} [[Category:1992 albums]] [[Category:Wiiija albums]] [[Category:Therapy? albums]]
